result.execSummary:
The defendant James A Kimmons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County Ordinance [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid in 30 days or penalty of 9 days jail for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James A Kimmons

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Mark Lipscomb in court.   Defendant James A Kimmons did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   The Defendant has completed treatment.  The State moves Count #2 to a county ordinance of disorderly conduct.  The Court amends the charge accordingly, enter a no contest plea and finds the defendant guilty.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.  
The Defendant was sentenced as follows:
FINE: $430.50 (includes domestic abuse surcharge) to be paid in 30 days or serve 9 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 24, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant James A Kimmons in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant is still enrolled in treatment and scheduled to finish in June.  There is an offer to amend to a forfeiture with completion of treatment.  The Defendant's appearance is waived if the treatment is completed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant James A Kimmons in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kimmons advises the Court the Defendant is scheduled to complete treatment in June.  The Court sets the matter in April to review progress.  Hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant James A Kimmons in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has had discussions with ADA Will and needs to have his client enroll in treatment. Defense requests another date in May, 2016.    State has offer to amend charge. Court will give a review date in December. Defense to provide the court with an update on the next date.  Hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant James A Kimmons in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.      Defendant is not to have any violent contact with the victim/witness listed in the complaint.

Defendant James A Kimmons in court with attorney Mark Lipscomb.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
